title: Ben Ray Luján’s Absence Strains Democrats’ Grip on 50-50 Senate
sub_head: Votes on nominations and legislation could face delays depending on pace of senator’s recovery after stroke
body:
WASHINGTON—The hospitalization of Sen. Ben Ray Luján is rippling through the Democratic caucus, setting the stage for potential delays in confirming President Biden’s nominees and advancing his legislative agenda.
On Wednesday an aide said that the New Mexico senator could return to work in four to six weeks, barring any complications. His office disclosed a day earlier that Mr. Luján had suffered a stroke last week and had surgery to ease swelling in his brain, adding that he was expected to make a full recovery.
